heading: DBStatusModel class
intro: This class can be used to fetch status and variables from the database server.
description:
This class extends the DBModel class and has methods for fetching status and variables from the server. Available methods are: fetchGlobalStatus(), fetchSessionStatus(), fetchGlobalVariables() and fetchSessionVariables().

All the methods have two optional arguments: $pattern and $where. Use $pattern for fetching a subset of the variables or status codes based on the name, and use $where to fetch based on the value of the variable or status codes. The pattern follows MySQL syntax, use % as a wildcard. The $where condition must be valid MySQL syntax, the columns are Value and Variable_name, a valid condition could for instance be Value='On' or Variable_name in('Bytes_received','Bytes_sent','Uptime').

These methods populate the model with the variables/status codes they fetch from the server, placeholders in the view must have names matching the variable/status name.
